result.execSummary:
The defendant Makala Mae Mott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process. 

Have no assaultive contact with R.M.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Minutes.
Preliminary hearing on June 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crime of physical abuse of a child.  The matter is continued for initial appearance on 06-13-22 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $1,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant is to have no assaultive contact with R.J.M., DOB: 08-14-2009.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.
